place.name: LLANGORWEN
place.gazetteerText: LLANGORWEN, a chapelry in Llanbadarn-Fawr parish, Cardigan; near Aberystwith r. station. It was constituted in 1864; and its Post town is Aberystwith. Pop., 1,025. The living is a p. curacy in the diocese of St. David's. Value, £93. Patrons, Trustees. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
